page.title: 12Education
page.content: Two systems operate in Soulbury/ Linslade. Children living in villages in the Aylesbury Vale Authority catchment area are bused to either a nearby village combined school comprising of infant, junior and middle school pupils all under one roof or on failing the Grammar school selection test, to the nearest secondary modern school. Those children passing the selection test could attend a Grammar school of which trere are three in Aylesbury. Parents may choose either Sir Henry Floyd Co-ed, High School for girls or Grammar school for boys. Children living in Bedfordshire attend Lower school, age 5-9, followed by Middle school, age 9-13.They attend a comprehensive Upper school from 13 to 18 years. In the Soulbury/Linslade area all schools are co-educational.
